segments.text: What did you do at the office today ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I had a really busy day . I had to work a little overtime . In the morning an important client called to place a large order . I had to check some things with my colleagues before confirming the order .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What kind of things did you need to check ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: The most important thing was to check that we had the goods in stock . If the goods are in stock , we can deliver them immediately . I also had to check the price . This customer is very important , so they get special prices .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . Did anything else happen ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I received a lot of emails from potential clients that I had to answer . Each time , I had to check files to see what we had agreed at earlier meetings . Each client has different conditions and requirements .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It must be difficult to remember the details for each individual client .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . That ’ s why we have everything on computer files . We don ’ t use much paper at our office . After lunch , I had to deal with a complaint from a client .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I hate dealing with complaints . Was it a legitimate complaint ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , it was . I managed to sort out the problem , but I was tied up with the matter for over an hour .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You certainly had a busy day .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s not all ! I also had to finish writing a sales report for my boss . In the end , I finished everything . I wonder what will be waiting for me tomorrow morning .
segments.speaker: S2
